sentences.sContent: The kitten is mainly white with black marks on her back.
sentences.sCn: 小猫身体基本为白色，背上有黑色斑点。

sentences.sContent: Make a mark at the bottom of the page.
A simple wooden cross marked her grave.
sentences.sCn: 一个简单的木十字架标出了她坟墓的位置。

sentences.sContent: ...the type that leaves a lasting mark on you as a writer...
...An extraordinarily important study skill is knowing how to mark a book...
...Usually you will mark about 10% of a passage...
...You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2with a single line through the centre...
...maybe you will mark main ideas in yellow...
...Perhaps it will become the mark of an author to reckon with that he or she is Still published in hard copy...
...You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre...
...read a whole paragraph before you mark anything...
...Some students mark new vocabulary in a different color...

phrases.pCn: n. 马克·吐温（美国小说家）
◎操行良好的标记；良好的评分
唛头；发货标记；装运标志
n. 水位标志；潮汐标尺；水印
打中目标；达到目的；成功

words.tran: 记分员；书签；标识物；作记号的人
表示（mark的过去分词）；作记号；打分数
注意；作记号于；给…打分数（mark的ing形式）

trans.tranOther: a small area of darker or lighter colour on a plain surface such as a person’s skin or an animal’s fur
